dublinCore.title: 113 S541 IS: Safeguard American Food Exports Act of 2013
dublinCore.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Landrieu(for herself andMr. Graham) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To prevent human health threats posed by the consumption of equines raised in the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safeguard American Food Exports Act of 2013 .

paragraph.text: equines raised in the United States are frequently treated with substances that are not approved for use in horses intended for human consumption and equine parts are therefore unsafe within the meaning ofsection 409 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act;

equines raised in the United States are frequently treated with drugs, including phen­yl­bu­ta­zone, acepromazine, boldenone un­dec­y­len­ate, omep­ra­zole, ketoprofen, xy­la­zine, hy­al­uron­ic acid, ni­tro­fu­ra­zone, polysulfated gly­cos­ami­no­gly­can, clenbuterol, tolazoline, and ponazuril, which are not approved for use in horses intended for human consumption and equine parts are therefore unsafe within the meaning ofsection 512 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act; and
consuming parts of an equine raised in the United States likely poses a serious threat to human health and the public should be protected from these unsafe products.

section.text: Section 301 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act( 21 U.S.C. 331 )is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section—

paragraph.text: equine parts shall be deemed unsafe undersection 409 of this Act;
equine parts shall be deemed unsafe undersection 512 of this Act; and
the knowing sale or transport of equines or equine parts in interstate or foreign commerce for purposes of human consumption is hereby prohibited.
